result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marci Renee Rasmussen

records.addlTxt:
- AMENDED

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion of law enforcement or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Defendant to follow visitation with children CJL and CRL as ordered in Family Case 22FA269.

10:31 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Marci Renee Rasmussen in court.  Attorney Katie J Bosworth in court for Marci Renee Rasmussen.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Becker recites joint recommendation to amended Ct 1- Possession of Amphetamines and DJOC for 1 Year.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to AMENDED Ct 1- Possession of Amphetamines 961.41(3g)(d) in 22CF374. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of AMENDED Ct 1 in 22CF374.  Court approves DJOC without probation. Court withholds entry of Judgement in favor of the DJOC on AMENDED Ct 1. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF374. Diversion staff to provide quarterly updates to the Court regarding DE's compliance.  ADA Becker makes bond argument.  Court amends bond. bph

The original document was titled: COMPAS

COMPAS

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion of law enforcement or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- No unsupervised contact with minor children, C.R.L. and C.J.L.

Signed by SRN on 9/7/22. Testing shall be suspended pending the conclusion of this matter. Maintain absolute sobriety. Subject to testing upon reasonable suspicion of law enforcement or at the direction of the Court. sf

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. - I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
